meanings.definition: To exaggerate or make something seem more dramatic than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She was overdramatizing the size of the spider in the corner.
meanings.sent2: Stop overdramatizing every little mistake you make.
meanings.sent3: The way he was overdramatizing his sneeze made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling was like overdramatizing a simple walk in the park into a grand adventure.
meanings.sent5: The movie director's style of overdramatizing every scene left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: To overemphasize emotions or reactions in a situation.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overdramatize his disappointment when things don't go his way.
meanings.sent2: Stop overdramatizing your fear of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: She was overdramatizing her excitement over winning a small prize.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor was overdramatizing the storm's impact to increase viewership.
meanings.sent5: The actor's performance was criticized for overdramatizing the character's emotions.
